Use the position of the sun to determine the time of day: By observing the position of the sun in the sky, you can determine the time of day. The sun rises in the east and sets in the west, so you can use this information to estimate the time.

Use the phases of the moon to determine the time of day: The moon goes through different phases throughout the month, and these phases can be used to estimate the time of day. For example, if the moon is at its full moon, it is usually visible in the sky around midnight.

Use the movement of animals to determine the time of day: Certain animals, such as birds and insects, have natural rhythms that can be used to estimate the time of day. For example, birds typically sing in the morning and evening, so you can use this information to estimate the time of day.

Use the movement of the stars to determine the time of day: The stars in the sky can be used to estimate the time of day. For example, if you know the position of the stars in the sky, you can use this information to estimate the time of day.

Use the movement of the tides to determine the time of day: The tides in the ocean can be used to estimate the time of day. For example, if you know the time of the last high tide, you can use this information to estimate the time of day.
